title: Europe Inc. Returns to the Skies
sub_head: Business travel is making a comeback on the continent, aided by a high vaccination rate and digital Covid-19 certificates
body:
Europeans are flying again for business, as executives hit the road and airlines add flights to key destinations.
The continent, one of the worldâ€™s biggest aviation markets, was slower than the U.S. and China to return to the skies. A fast vaccination drive and the rollout of a vaccine passport program lifted vacation travel this summer. Now, business travel is bouncing back too.
